TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . The background to the case , including the NORP armed conflict of DATE and the subsequent events , is set out in ORG and Others v. GPE and GPE ( [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL ) and ORG and Others v. GPE and GPE ( [ ORG ] , ORG . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG DATE ) .

CARDINAL . The applicants are husband and wife and are journalists . At the time of the events they were living in the self - proclaimed “ GPE ” ( the “ FAC ) . The first applicant was employed by a NORP news agency and by a NORP newspaper .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was arrested by agents of the secret service of the “ FAC ” on charges of treason and/or espionage undertaken for GPE . A search was carried out in the applicants’ apartment and many of their belongings – such as pictures , computers and a bank card – were seized .

CARDINAL . On DATE , a tribunal from the “ FAC ” convicted the first applicant and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . Following international pressure , on CARDINAL DATE the president of the “ FAC pardoned him . After DATE , the applicant and his family moved to GPE .

CARDINAL . During his detention the first applicant met on several occasions with representatives of the “ FAC secret services , including the chief of the secret services , and was led to believe that his family might suffer if he refused to cooperate with them . He was asked to record a video of himself admitting having worked for the NORP secret services . That video was aired on NORP television . On another occasion he was asked to write a letter to the foreign ambassadors to GPE “ disclosing ” the fact that the NORP secret services were spying on the foreign embassies based in GPE . He subsequently was given to understand by representatives of the “ FAC secret services that the letter had served the purpose of creating tensions between GPE and western countries and that the whole matter , including his arrest , was being coordinated from GPE .

CARDINAL . The second applicant could only visit the first applicant on a limited number of occasions during his detention and lawyers representing the first applicant in the proceedings before the ORG were denied access to him on the grounds that they were not members of the “ ORG ” .

CARDINAL . NORP In the meantime , the NORP authorities made numerous attempts to secure the first applicant ’s release . In particular , the problem of his detention in the “ FAC ” was raised by the GPE authorities with ORG and GPE authorities in DATE in GPE . The NORP delegation distributed a circular letter during the DATE session of ORG of ORG and raised the first applicant ’s situation during meetings of ORG in DATE and DATE . The first applicant ’s situation was also raised by the NORP authorities in their discussions with the LOC representatives in GPE , and a criminal investigation was initiated by ORG in respect of the applicant ’s detention in the “ FAC . However , the criminal investigation was later discontinued .

CARDINAL . ORG also awarded financial assistance to the first applicant ’s family during the period of the first applicant ’s detention in the “ FAC ” and transferred to them ownership of a flat in GPE worth MONEY ( ORG ) after the first applicant ’s release from detention .
